content:
From: Peter Gammie <peteg42@gmail.com>
Hello,

I just tried to use \<bbbA> (“𝔸”) as a variable. (It appears in the Symbols panel — can we also have a non-bold variant?) The lexer chokes on it.

term "\<bbbA>"

Inner lexical error⌂
Failed to parse term

Also what does the trailing “⌂” in the above error signify?

cheers,
peter

From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
On 27/04/2023 03:44, Peter Gammie wrote:

I just tried to use \<bbbA> (“𝔸”) as a variable. (It appears in the Symbols panel — can we also have a non-bold variant?) The lexer chokes on it.

\<bbbA> is not a letter. You need to use it with 'notation' or 'write' in a
proof.

See also the isar-ref manual on the syntax category "letter".

Also what does the trailing “⌂” in the above error signify?

CTRL-hover-click in the Prover IDE will tell you: It is a formal position.

Makarius
